programs.title: Cancer Awareness Cum Detection Camp
programs.shortDescription: Regular camps for cancer awareness and early detection in Tibetan communities.
programs.fullDescription: Our Cancer Awareness Cum Detection Camps are comprehensive events organized in various Tibetan settlements to raise awareness about cancer and provide free screening services. These camps combine educational sessions with practical screening activities, helping community members understand cancer risks while offering immediate screening services for early detection.
features: Distribution of awareness materials in Tibetan
Follow-up care coordination for positive screenings

programs.title: World Cancer Day
programs.shortDescription: Annual events and activities to mark World Cancer Day on February 4th.
programs.fullDescription: Every year on February 4th, we organize special events to mark World Cancer Day. These events aim to inspire action, raise awareness, and reduce stigma around cancer in the Tibetan community. Our World Cancer Day activities include educational sessions, survivor testimonials, memorial ceremonies, and community engagement initiatives that promote cancer prevention and support.
features: Memorial ceremonies for those lost to cancer

programs.title: Patient Support
programs.shortDescription: Find emotional support, financial assistance, and practical help during your cancer journey.
programs.fullDescription: Our Patient Support program provides comprehensive assistance to cancer patients and their families. We offer emotional support through counseling, financial assistance for treatment costs, transportation to medical appointments, and help navigating the healthcare system.
features: Accommodation assistance for patients traveling for treatment

programs.title: Compassion Home
programs.shortDescription: A safe and supportive residence for cancer patients undergoing treatment away from home.
programs.fullDescription: Compassion Home provides temporary accommodation for cancer patients who need to travel away from their homes for treatment. Our facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment where patients can stay during their treatment period, reducing the financial and logistical burden of finding accommodation near treatment centers.
features: Transportation to and from treatment centers
Emotional support from staff and fellow residents

programs.title: Ambulance Services
programs.shortDescription: Emergency and scheduled transportation for cancer patients to medical facilities.
programs.fullDescription: Our Ambulance Services provide critical transportation for cancer patients who need to reach medical facilities for treatment, emergencies, or routine appointments. This service is especially important for elderly patients and those with mobility issues, ensuring they can access necessary medical care without transportation barriers.
features: Service available across all Tibetan settlements

programs.title: Community Kitchen
programs.shortDescription: Providing nutritious meals for cancer patients and their families during treatment.
programs.fullDescription: Our Community Kitchen program prepares and delivers nutritious meals to cancer patients and their families. Proper nutrition is crucial during cancer treatment, yet many patients struggle with meal preparation due to fatigue, treatment side effects, or financial constraints. Our kitchen provides healthy, specially prepared meals that support patients' nutritional needs during treatment.
features: Nutritionally balanced meals designed for cancer patients
Consideration of dietary restrictions and preferences
Meals for patients and immediate family members

programs.title: Meals for Invisibles
programs.shortDescription: Providing food for homeless and underprivileged cancer patients who often go unnoticed.
programs.fullDescription: The Meals for Invisible project began as an urgent response to the devastating impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the most vulnerable in our community—drug addicts, substance abusers, destitute individuals, and others often overlooked due to stigma. These "Invisible" members faced acute hunger, poverty, and lack of access to basic needs. Over two months, the project provided nutritious two-time meals daily to over 100 underprivileged people, helping boost their immunity and protect them from the virus. It also created opportunities for stranded youth to volunteer and earn wages, easing their financial burdens during difficult times. Today, the project has grown into a broader food charity drive, extending support to disadvantaged Indian destitute, poor patients seeking medical care at government hospitals, daily wagers, and others in need. With the help of generous donors, meals are provided regularly, often sponsored in honor of birthdays, death anniversaries, and other significant occasions. Meals for Invisible continues to serve as a vital lifeline, restoring dignity and hope to those society often forgets.
features: Daily meal distribution in key locations
Outreach to identify and support homeless cancer patients
Coordination with local shelters and social services

programs.title: Sunday Program
programs.shortDescription: Weekly gatherings for cancer patients and survivors to connect, share, and heal together.
programs.fullDescription: Our Sunday Program provides a regular gathering space for cancer patients, survivors, and their families. Every Sunday, we host activities that promote healing, connection, and emotional wellbeing. These gatherings include support group discussions, meditation sessions, art therapy, educational talks, and simply sharing meals together in a supportive community environment.

programs.title: Cancer Information
programs.shortDescription: Access reliable information about different types of cancer, treatments, and prevention strategies.
programs.fullDescription: Our Cancer Information program provides accurate, up-to-date information about various types of cancer, treatment options, side effects, and prevention strategies. We offer resources in both Tibetan and English to ensure accessibility for all community members.
features: Educational materials in Tibetan and English

programs.title: Screening Programs
programs.shortDescription: Early detection saves lives. Learn about our cancer screening programs and how to participate.
programs.fullDescription: Our Screening Programs focus on early detection of cancer, which significantly improves treatment outcomes. We conduct regular screening camps in Tibetan settlements for breast, cervical, oral, and lung cancers. Our mobile screening unit brings these vital services to remote communities.
features: Mobile screening unit for remote settlements
Regular screening camps in Tibetan communities
Screening for breast, cervical, oral, and lung cancers

programs.title: Support Groups
programs.shortDescription: Connect with others who understand what you're going through in our community support groups.
programs.fullDescription: Our Support Groups bring together cancer patients, survivors, and caregivers to share experiences, coping strategies, and emotional support. These groups provide a safe space for community members to connect with others who truly understand the cancer journey.
features: Regular meetings in major Tibetan settlements
Separate groups for patients, survivors, and caregivers
Virtual support options for remote participants
Special focus groups for specific cancer types

programs.title: Mobile Cancer Screening Program
programs.shortDescription: Our mobile screening program brings cancer detection services directly to remote Tibetan settlements.
programs.fullDescription: The Mobile Cancer Screening Program is our flagship initiative that brings essential cancer screening services directly to remote Tibetan settlements. Equipped with portable diagnostic equipment and staffed by trained healthcare professionals, our mobile unit conducts screenings for common cancers and provides immediate consultations.
features: Portable diagnostic equipment for on-site screenings
Screenings for breast, cervical, oral, and lung cancers

programs.title: Awareness Campaigns
programs.shortDescription: Spreading knowledge about cancer prevention, early detection, and treatment options throughout the Tibetan community.
programs.fullDescription: Our Awareness Campaigns aim to educate the Tibetan community about cancer prevention, risk factors, symptoms, and the importance of early detection. Through workshops, seminars, and media campaigns, we work to reduce cancer stigma and encourage proactive health behaviors.
features: Media campaigns on radio and social platforms
